data: CARD SURG Lead Extraction Post Operative CSICU Admission
Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
Complete Admission or Transfer Medication Reconciliation
Discontinue CARD SURG Day of Surgery PowerPlan
1 - No CPR, Supportive Care, No Intubation
2- No CPR, Therapeutic Care, No Intubation
3 - No CPR, Acute Transfer, No Intubation
4 - No CPR, Critical Care, No Intubation
5 - No CPR, Critical Care, May Intubate
MAP goal: 65 mmHg or greater,SpO2 goal: 92% or greater, SBP goal: less than 140 mmHg, Hgb Goal: 75 g/L or greater. Special Instructions: keep HR ___ bpm
MAP goal: 65 mmHg or greater,SpO2 goal: 92% or greater, SBP goal: less than 140 mmHg, Hgb Goal: 80 g/L or greater. Special Instructions: keep HR ___ bpm
MAP goal: 65 mmHg or greater,SpO2 goal: 92% or greater, SBP goal: less than 140 mmHg, Hgb Goal: 85 g/L or greater. Special Instructions:keep HR ___ bpm
RASS goal of 0, Alert and Calm
RASS goal of -1, Drowsy, sustained eye opening and eye contact for more than 10 seconds to voice
RASS goal of -2, Light sedation, eye opening and eye contact for less than 10 seconds to voice
RASS goal of -3, Moderate sedation, movement but no eye contact to voice
RASS goal of -4, Deep sedation, no response to voice, only rousable to pain
Provide warming blanket for temperature below 36.5 DegC
When drainage is less than 5 mL/24h or POD 3
PICC Insertion on POD 1, at location: left side
PICC Insertion on POD 1, at location: right side
T;N, Reason for Consult: For PICC line insertion
Notify Interventional Radiology if IV Therapy unsuccessful with PICC insertion
1 mL, intradermal, q5min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
If/when PICC line is inserted, then place XR Chest, to confirm tip PICC placement before use
Order PICC tray in advance to PICC insertion
Turn patient q2h, maintain HOB 30 degrees or greater
1.5 L/day, Including feeds, Including IV fluids
1 L/day, Including feeds, Including IV fluids
2 L/day, Including feeds, Including IV fluids
KCL 40 mmol/L-dextrose 5%-sodium chloride 0.9% (KCL 40 mmol/L-D5W-NaCL 0.9% continuous infusion)
order rate: 30 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
500 mL, IV, once, PRN other (see comment) order duration: 24 hour, drug form bag

titrate, IV, mcg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/min minimum rate, 5 mcg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to maintain critical care goals

dose range: 5 to 10 mg, IV, q5min, PRN hypertension, drug form: inj
titrate, IV, mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 100 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to maintain RASS goal
20 mg, IV, as directed, PRN sedation, order duration: 2 doses or timesdrug form:inj

dose range: 2.5 to 5 mg, PO, q4h, PRN delirium, drug form: tab

NSAIDs contraindicated if:
- eGFR is below 60 mL/min (below 75 mL/min in diabetic patients)
- Platelets below 50
- Initial chest tube losses are greater than 350 mL
- Patient has history of asthma
- Patient has heart failure (EF below 40%)
250 mg, PO, BID with food, PRN pain, drug form: tab

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
2000 mg, IV, q8h, drug form: bag
150 mg, PO, q12h interval, drug form: tab

4 mg, IV, q8h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj

Urgent, Reason: CSICU Admission, Transport: Portable, Portable Reason: Requires constant monitoring/observation
Vt 6 to 10 mL/kg, PEEP 5 to 10 cm H2O, Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater, RR below 25/min
Consider consultation with Cardiology, Electrophysiology, Pacemaker Clinic, Heart Function Clinic (if pre-op EF less than 40%) and Infectious Disease
